Final Model: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. - Length (X direction): 0.375 units - Width (Y direction): 0.375 units - Height (Z direction): 0.75 units</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is slightly tilted to the right. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. On the XY plane of the coordinate system, draw a rectangle by creating line 1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0], line 2 from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.75], line 3 from point [0.75, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75], and line 4 from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive Z-axis by 0.075 units. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times the diameter of the base. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object is centered and has a smooth surface. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.3, 0.3, 0.075]. 2. On the XY plane of the coordinate system, draw a circle with center at point [0.075, 0.075] and radius of 0.075 units. 3. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.15. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.375 units. 6. Cut the extruded cylindrical object from the previously constructed prism. Final shape: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is white and has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is also white and has a smaller diameter than the prism. The prism is slightly tilted to the right. The overall shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. 1. The final shape consists of the previously constructed prism and cylindrical object. 2. The prism has a length of 0.75 units, width of 0.75 units, and height of 0.075 units. 3. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.15 units and a height of 0.375 units. 4. The overall shape is slightly tilted to the right due to the translation vector of the coordinate system used for the cylindrical object. 5. The prism and cylindrical object are both white and have a smooth surface. 6. The intersection of the prism and cylindrical hole forms the final shape. 7. Ensure that the operation to combine the prism and cylindrical object is set to "NewBodyFeatureOperation".</description>
